rename.from: rclone appends // to webdav URL, which breaks a GET URL
rename.to: rclone appends path to webdav URL, which breaks a GET URL

rename.from: rclone appends path to webdav URL, which breaks a GET URL
rename.to: rclone appends path to webdav URL, which breaks a GET URL with variables

body:
Hmm, yes, that does indeed look like a bug.

Can you supply the macaroon as a header instead of a URL parameter?  That would be easier to implement?

Which WebDAV server is this?
Yes, providing the macaroon in a header is possible. So https://github.com/ncw/rclone/issues/59 would provide a workaround, in this case.

Background info: https://www.dcache.org/manuals/workshop-2017-05-29-Umea/000-Final/anupam_macaroons_v02.pdf

See page 9 for how the header would be specified.

The WebDAV server is dCache, in which we currently have 43 petabyte of scientific data (from CERN's LHC, Lofar radio astronomy, Project MinE ALS/MND research, Virgo gravitational wave detector, Tropomi atmosphere measuring satellite and many more). It would be awesome if we could disclose some of this data with rclone this way!

Thanks for the info - very helpful.

I've implemented a bearer token input for the webdav client.  It will ask for it in the initial setup - leave username and password blank.

Let me know if that works!

https://beta.rclone.org/v1.42-010-gb01921d0-fix-2360-macaroon/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

Thanks for your fast and very elegant solution (I like that the bearer token is defined in the remote!)

It seems to work in a quick download test:

    onno$ rclone-v1.42-010-gb01921d0-fix-2360-macaroonβ-linux-amd64/rclone --verbose=10 copy macaroon-1:/users/onno/diskandtape/test1 test-macaroon1
    2018/06/25 18:07:36 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.42-010-gb01921d0-fix-2360-macaroonβ" starting with parameters ["rclone-v1.42-010-gb01921d0-fix-2360-macaroonβ-linux-amd64/rclone" "--verbose=10" "copy" "macaroon-1:/users/onno/diskandtape/test1" "test-macaroon1"]
    2018/06/25 18:07:36 DEBUG : Using config file from "/home/onno/.config/rclone/rclone.conf"
    2018/06/25 18:07:36 DEBUG : test1: Couldn't find file - need to transfer
    2018/06/25 18:07:36 INFO  : test1: Copied (new)
    2018/06/25 18:07:36 INFO  : 
    Transferred:   1.059 kBytes (5.631 kBytes/s)
    Errors:                 0
    Checks:                 0
    Transferred:            1
    Elapsed time:       100ms

    2018/06/25 18:07:36 DEBUG : 5 go routines active
    2018/06/25 18:07:36 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.42-010-gb01921d0-fix-2360-macaroonβ" finishing with parameters ["rclone-v1.42-010-gb01921d0-fix-2360-macaroonβ-linux-amd64/rclone" "--verbose=10" "copy" "macaroon-1:/users/onno/diskandtape/test1" "test-macaroon1"]

The result:

    onno$ ls -l test-macaroon1/
    total 4
    -rw-rw-r--. 1 onno onno 1084 Jun 13 10:53 test1

I don't understand the difference in bytes but the contents of the file seem OK.

I'll try some more tests later today.

I don't understand the difference in bytes but the contents of the file seem OK.

Did you mean this?

    1.059*1024 = 1084.416

Thanks for testing.  I'll write some docs and merge it! Let me know if you find any problems.

I've merged this to master here:

https://beta.rclone.org/v1.42-012-gfa051ff9/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

Let me know if it all works - thanks

Uploading with rclone-v1.42-012-gfa051ff9β using a macaroon works fine!

```
onno$ rclone-v1.42-012-gfa051ff9β-linux-amd64/rclone --verbose=10 copy test-webdav macaroon-1:
2018/06/25 23:26:36 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.42-012-gfa051ff9β" starting with parameters ["rclone-v1.42-012-gfa051ff9β-linux-amd64/rclone" "--verbose=10" "copy" "test-webdav" "macaroon-1:"]
2018/06/25 23:26:36 DEBUG : Using config file from "/home/onno/.config/rclone/rclone.conf"
2018/06/25 23:26:36 DEBUG : test-webdav: Couldn't find file - need to transfer
2018/06/25 23:26:37 INFO  : test-webdav: Copied (new)
2018/06/25 23:26:37 INFO  : 
Transferred:     12 Bytes (25 Bytes/s)
Errors:                 0
Checks:                 0
Transferred:            1
Elapsed time:       400ms

2018/06/25 23:26:37 DEBUG : 3 go routines active
2018/06/25 23:26:37 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.42-012-gfa051ff9β" finishing with parameters ["rclone-v1.42-012-gfa051ff9β-linux-amd64/rclone" "--verbose=10" "copy" "test-webdav" "macaroon-1:"]
```

We'll continue testing the coming weeks and if there are bugs we'll let you know.

> 1.059*1024 = 1084.416

Ah, of course... Had overlooked the `k`.
I did some more tests, it seems to work perfectly. I've created a script that can generate an rclone config with a token. https://github.com/onnozweers/dcache-scripts/blob/master/get-share-link

Excellent :-)  I like your script.  Do you want to send a pull request [for the docs](https://github.com/ncw/rclone/blob/master/docs/content/webdav.md#dcache) and add  sentence or two about your script and a link?

Also if you correct anything I already wrote about dCache that would be great too!

issue.title: webdav.md: about Macaroons

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body: Added a paragraph about Macaroons; added link to script that obtains a Macaroon, as suggested at https://github.com/ncw/rclone/issues/2360#issuecomment-402519344
